DOC.brief_summary: Objective 1 : Determine Vitamin D supplementation improve body composition , reduce injury illness , improve performance collegiate swimmer diver . Objective 2 : Examine baseline Vitamin D level predict outcome variable course intervention period .
DOC.brief_title: A Prospective Trial Effects Vitamin D Supplementation Collegiate Swimmers Divers
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator plan recruit approximately 45 male female University Kentucky Swimmers Divers , least 18 year age August 2011 . Approximately equal number men woman recruit . The entire athletic team ( ) recruit . With conservative dropout rate 30 % , investigator final sample size approximately 22 participant ( per group ) .Following baseline measure , participant randomize one two group ( Vitamin D 4000 IU Placebo control ) monitor course athletic season . Measurements repeat Midpoint ( 3 month ) Endpoint ( 6 month ) . Participants recent history Vitamin D supplementation beyond normally find multivitamin ( 400 IUs ) . Following informed consent process medical history Vitamin D questionnaire ( screening ) , urine pregnancy test ( female athlete ) administer prior invasive baseline testing procedure ( blood draw DXA ) . A blood draw conduct baseline , midpoint endpoint . Collected blood purpose study assess Vitamin D status ( 25 ( OH ) D ) , parathyroid hormone , ionized calcium , bone turnover marker , inflammatory cytokine . A Vitamin D lifestyle questionnaire administer 3 time point incidence illness injury document 6 month follow randomization . DXA measure occur Baseline Endpoint .
DOC.criteria: University Kentucky Swimmers Divers , least 18 year old . No recent history Vitamin D supplementation beyond 400IU hormone replacement therapy , high dose Vitamin D supplementation , history renal disease kidney stone , organ transplantation , sarcoidosis , parathyroid disease , history high blood calcium level .
